page.title: 13RELIGION IN THEDDINGWORTH
page.content: The village is amalgamated with three other parishes, and the vicar lives in Husbands Bosworth, being the largest parish. There is a service in the Church each Sunday with an average attendance of 16, increased to an average of 50 for festivals such as Christmas, Easter & Harvest. The village has a Sunday School which also meets in the Church each week with 16 members. There is a Congregational Chapel built in 1833 which stands in a graveyard on the main road and still in use. A visiting preacher takes fortnightly services for a congregation of 5. Seven people from the village attend Roman Catholic Churches in the area. Hothorpe Hall, built 1801, is now an Anglican Conference Centre & is privately owned. The Hall has its own Chapel originally Catholic but now Anglican.
